wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Thompson (c. 1873 − 13 January 1958) was an English footballer who played as a goalkeeper in the Football League around the turn of the 19th century. Playing for Bury, he was an FA Cup winner in 1900.

response: Frederick or Fred Thompson may refer to:
* Fred Thompson (footballer, born c. 1873) (c. 1873–1958), English footballer
* Fred Thompson (rugby union) (1890–1915), Australian rugby union player
* Fred Thompson (coach) (1933–2019), American lawyer and track and field coach
* Fred Thompson (1942–2015), American politician and actor
* Fred Thompson (writer) (1884–1949), English writer and librettist

Fiske left the club at the end of the season, allowing Kidd to become the first-choice 'keeper for 1914-15. He played in the first 30 League games before leaving the club for Bolton Wanderers. Two other goalkeepers — James Mitchell and Fred Thompson —  played for Blackpool in the eight remaining games of the season.Calley, pp. 204–205.

Along with City goalkeeper Fred Thompson, Jex headed north to Doncaster Rovers who were playing in the Midland League. That season Doncaster finished 11th with Jex scoring an excellent 20 goals in his 27 league games, and once in the Sheffield and Hallamshire Senior Cup.
